discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. AWS Budgets
D is correct.

D, AWS Budgets is a service that allows you to set custom cost and usage budgets for your AWS resources. You can define your monthly spending limit using AWS Budgets, and then create alerts that notify you when your spending exceeds a certain threshold. This allows you to proactively manage your costs and prevent any unexpected charges.

Selected Answer: D
AWS Budgets (Option D).

Selected Answer: D
The AWS service or tool that the company should use to set a maximum spending limit on AWS services each month and set up alerts for when the company reaches its spending limit is AWS Budgets (Option D).

AWS Budgets is a free tool that allows customers to set custom cost and usage budgets that notify them when costs or usage exceed (or are forecasted to exceed) their budgeted amounts. AWS Budgets provides alerts via email and/or SMS when actual or forecasted costs exceed the thresholds set by the customer.

Selected Answer: D
With AWS Budgets, set custom budgets to track your costs and usage, and respond quickly to alerts received from email or SNS notifications if you exceed your threshold.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to set a maximum spending limit on AWS services each month. The company also needs to set up alerts for when the company reaches its spending limit.

Which AWS service or tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
What is an AWS responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Ensure the security of the internal network in the AWS data centers.

Selected Answer: B
Option B is the correct answer.

Option B is the correct answer. Under the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for securing the underlying infrastructure that supports its cloud services, such as the physical facilities, network infrastructure, and hardware, while customers are responsible for security configuration and management tasks, including patching the guest operating system with the latest security patches on Amazon EC2.

Selected Answer: B
(B) is the correct response.

Selected Answer: B
Under the AWS shared responsibility model, an AWS responsibility is to ensure the security of the internal network in the AWS data centers (Option B).

The AWS shared responsibility model defines the security responsibilities between AWS and the customer. AWS is responsible for the security of the underlying infrastructure, including the physical security of the data centers, the security of the network infrastructure, and the security of the hypervisor. The customer is responsible for the security of their applications and data in the cloud.

Selected Answer: B
(B) is the correct response.

Nope - patching the guest operating system with the latest security patches on Amazon EC2, is a customer responsibility.
It should be B - AWS is responsible for securing the underlying infrastructure that supports its cloud services, such as the physical facilities, network infrastructure, and hardware.

choices.D: Turn on server-side encryption for Amazon S3 buckets.
choices.B: Ensure the security of the internal network in the AWS data centers.
choices.C: Patch the guest operating system with the latest security patches on Amazon EC2.
choices.A: Configure the security group rules that determine which ports are open on an Amazon EC2 Linux instance.

questions.question_text: Which AWS service or feature allows users to securely store encrypted credentials and retrieve these credentials when required?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Secrets Manager

C. AWS Secrets Manager is a fully-managed service that enables you to store and retrieve credentials and secrets via API or the AWS Management Console securely. It provides an easy and secure way to store and manage secrets used by your applications and services. The stored secrets can be encrypted using AWS KMS, and you can define fine-grained permissions to control access to the secrets. AWS Secrets Manager enables you to rotate secrets safely without requiring any code updates.

Selected Answer: C
The AWS service that allows users to securely store encrypted credentials and retrieve these credentials when required is AWS Secrets Manager (Option C).

AWS Secrets Manager is a secrets management service that enables the storage and retrieval of secrets such as database credentials, API keys, and other secrets. It stores the secrets securely using encryption and also provides an API to retrieve the secrets when required. The secrets can be rotated automatically, and access to secrets can be managed using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.

Selected Answer: A
A. AWS Lambda

"You can use the Amazon S3 Event Notifications feature to receive notifications when certain events happen in your S3 bucket, such as PUT, POST, COPY, and DELETE events. You can publish notifications to Amazon EventBridge, Amazon SNS, Amazon SQS, or directly to AWS Lambda."

https://aws.amazon.com/s3/faqs/?nc=sn&loc=7#:~:text=You%20can%20use%20the%20Amazon%20S3%20Event%20Notifications%20feature%20to%20receive%20notifications%20when%20certain%20events%20happen%20in%20your%20S3%20bucket%2C%20such%20as%20PUT%2C%20POST%2C%20COPY%2C%20and%20DELETE%20events.%20You%20can%20publish%20notifications%20to%20Amazon%20EventBridge%2C%C2%A0Amazon%20SNS%2C%20Amazon%20SQS%2C%20or%20directly%20to%20AWS%20Lambda.

The correct AWS service that will integrate directly with the event notification when objects are uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket is AWS Lambda (Option A), which allows companies to run code in response to events, including S3 events, without having to manage servers or infrastructure. Companies can write their own code or use prebuilt functions in AWS Lambda to process S3 events and perform tasks such as transcoding media files or processing data.

Selected Answer: A
The AWS service that will integrate directly with the event notification when objects are uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket is AWS Lambda (Option A).

AWS Lambda is a serverless computing service that allows developers to run code in response to events and automatically manages the underlying infrastructure. It integrates seamlessly with Amazon S3 and allows developers to create event-driven applications that run code automatically in response to S3 events, such as object creation, object deletion, or object restore.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to run code in response to an event notification that occurs when objects are uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket.

Which AWS service will integrate directly with the event notification?
Which AWS services support a hybrid compute architectural model? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
AWS hybrid cloud services
"AWS Outposts allows you to run AWS infrastructure and services on premises for a consistent hybrid experience."
"AWS Wavelength embeds AWS compute and storage services at the edge of 5G networks for a faster application response time."

Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/

Selected Answer: BD
https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/

Selected Answer: BD
AWS Wavelength
AWS Outposts

Selected Answer: BD
B. AWS Wavelength
D. AWS Outposts

https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/#:~:text=your%20end%2Dusers.-,AWS%20hybrid%20cloud%20services,-Compute



E. VMware Cloud on AWS , this is not hybrid, instead it is cloud service that running VMware on AWS.

Selected Answer: DE
D. AWS Outposts
E. VMware Cloud on AWS

AWS Outposts (Option D) and VMware Cloud on AWS (Option E).

AWS Outposts allows customers to run AWS services on-premises, providing a hybrid cloud solution. It allows customers to use the same APIs, control plane, and tools they use in the AWS cloud to run applications on-premises, using their own hardware.

VMware Cloud on AWS provides a hybrid cloud solution that allows customers to run VMware workloads on AWS infrastructure. Customers can use the same VMware tools they use in their on-premises environments to manage workloads running in the AWS cloud.

Selected Answer: DE
I'll say D and E

its B and D
https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/#:~:text=AWS%20Outposts%20allows%20you%20to,for%20a%20consistent%20hybrid%20experience.&text=AWS%20Wavelength%20embeds%20AWS%20compute,a%20faster%20application%20response%20time.

Selected Answer: DE
The two AWS services that support a hybrid compute architectural model are:

D. AWS Outposts: AWS Outposts is a fully managed service that extends AWS infrastructure, services, APIs, and tools to virtually any datacenter, co-location space, or on-premises facility for a truly consistent hybrid experience. AWS Outposts allows customers to run compute and storage on-premises using the same AWS APIs, tools, and infrastructure services they use in AWS Cloud.

E. VMware Cloud on AWS: VMware Cloud on AWS is an integrated cloud offering jointly developed by AWS and VMware that delivers a highly scalable, secure, and innovative service that allows customers to seamlessly migrate and extend their on-premises VMware vSphere-based environments to the AWS Cloud running on next-generation Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) bare metal infrastructure.

Selected Answer: BD
AWS Hybrid cloud services are:
Outpost, Wavelength, Local Zones and Snow. The link provided by lindawinterrain clearly shows this

Option D, AWS Outposts, is a fully-managed service that extends AWS infrastructure and services to customer premises or co-location facilities, enabling a hybrid architecture.

Option E, VMware Cloud on AWS, is a jointly-engineered cloud service that allows customers to run VMware workloads on the AWS Cloud, providing a seamless hybrid environment.

BD https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/#:~:text=AWS%20Outposts%20allows%20you%20to,for%20a%20consistent%20hybrid%20experience.&text=AWS%20Wavelength%20embeds%20AWS%20compute,a%20faster%20application%20response%20time.
